snippet: This fall it may be even less rewarding to be top-seeded teams, which will open on the road for the first two division series games.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that the Major League Baseball postseason may be even less rewarding for top-seeded teams this season; notes that because of a constraint in wild-card scheduling, higher-seeded teams will open on the road for the first two division series games.
lead_paragraph: This fall it may be even less rewarding to be top-seeded teams, which will open on the road for the first two division series games.

headline.seo: Adding Wild-Card Play-In Puts No. 1 Seeds in Tough Spot
headline.main: For No. 1 Seeds, Road to Title Comes With Bumps
headline.print_headline: For No. 1 Seeds, Road to Title Comes With Bumps
